title: How to Make Eggless Cupcakes

methods.name: Making Eggless Vanilla Cupcakes Using Applesauce

steps.headline: Preheat the oven.
steps.description:
Turn on your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Take out a 12 cup muffin tin and place muffin liners in each hole. If you don't have muffin liners, grease and flour the holes or spray them with cooking spray. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/94\/Make-Eggless-Cupcakes-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/94\/Make-Eggless-Cupcakes-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":508,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} To make the cupcakes come out even easier, consider spraying the muffin liners with cooking spray. This can also help them brown more evenly during baking.

steps.headline: Mix the dry ingredients.
steps.description:
Place all of the dry ingredients into a medium bowl and whisk them for about 30 seconds. This will break up any lumps, aerate the flour and distribute the leavening. To make 12 eggless vanilla cupcakes, you'll need these dry ingredients:
1 1/2 cups (180 g) of cake flour
1/2 teaspoons of baking soda
2 teaspoons of baking powder
1 pinch of salt

steps.headline: Combine the butter and sugar before adding applesauce.
steps.description: In a separate medium-sized mixing bowl, cream the 1/2 cup (115 g) of butter with the 1/2 cup (100 g) of sugar. Beat them for a few minutes until the mixture is light and fluffy. Take a rubber spatula and fold in 1 1/4 cup (236 g) of unsweetened applesauce. Avoid stirring the applesauce in too much or the butter and sugar mixture will become dense. Simply folding in the applesauce, using a twisting motion with your wrist, will make light and fluffy cupcakes.

steps.headline: Stir in the milk.
steps.description: Stir 1/2 cup (120 ml) of milk into the wet ingredients. Gently stir in the milk so it's combined with your butter, sugar and applesauce. The mixture will look very runny and wet. There shouldn't be any lumps. You can use any type of milk. Keep in mind that the milk higher in fats will make richer cupcakes.

steps.headline: Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Take the bowl of dry ingredients and carefully add the dry ingredients to your bowl of wet ingredients. Stir the dry ingredients in using a rubber spatula. Stir until the ingredients are completely combined. The cupcake batter will still be slightly runny and smooth.

steps.headline: Divide the batter among the muffin tin.
steps.description: Use a measuring scoop, spoons, or a cookie scoop to fill your muffin liners or greased muffin holes with the cupcake batter. Fill each muffin hole or liner two-thirds full with the cupcake batter. Cookie scoops are easy to use when filling the liners. Depending on the size of your cookie scoop, you may need a few scoops of batter for each liner or hole.

steps.headline: Bake your eggless vanilla cupcakes.
steps.description: Place your filled muffin tin in the preheated oven and bake the cupcakes for 15 to 20 minutes. Test the cupcakes to see if they're done by inserting a cake tester or toothpick in the center of a cupcake. If it comes out clean, the cupcakes are baked. If it comes out with batter stuck to it, the cupcakes need to bake longer. Add just a few minutes baking time to your cupcakes and keep checking them for to see if they're done.

steps.headline: Cool the cupcakes.
steps.description: Remove the cupcakes from the oven and let them cool in the muffin tin for a few minutes before removing them to a cooling rack. Let the cupcakes cool completely before frosting them or eating them. Store the cupcakes in an airtight container until you're ready to eat them or frost them. You can use almost any flavor of frosting to finish these eggless vanilla cupcakes.

methods.name: Making Eggless Chocolate Cupcakes Using Bananas

steps.headline: Preheat the oven.
steps.description:
Turn on your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Take a 12 hole muffin tin and grease and flour it. You could also line the muffin pan with cupcake liners or just use cooking spray. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b7\/Make-Eggless-Cupcakes-Step-9-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b7\/Make-Eggless-Cupcakes-Step-9-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":508,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} You can also spray the cupcake liners so they peel away easily from the cupcakes.

steps.headline: Combine your dry ingredients.
steps.description:
Place the dry ingredients in a medium-sized bowl and whisk to combine them. You shouldn't be able to see any lumps and the cocoa should be evenly distributed so the mixture is a light brown color. Put these dry ingredients in the bowl:
1 1/4 cups (156 g) of all-purpose flour
1/3 cup (40 g) of cocoa powder
1 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder
1 teaspoon of baking soda
1/2 teaspoons of salt

steps.headline: Mix together the wet ingredients.
steps.description:
Put 2 mashed bananas and 1/2 cup (100 g) of granulated sugar into a separate large bowl. Stir them together. Stir in the following wet ingredients:
1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons (82 g) of vegetable oil
1/2 cup (120 ml) of milk
1 teaspoon of vanilla extract

steps.headline: Stir together the eggless chocolate cupcake batter.
steps.description: Add a little of the dry ingredient mixture to your large bowl of wet ingredients and stir it together, using a rubber spatula or wooden spoon. Add the rest of the dry ingredients and stir the batter until there aren't any lumps or pockets of flour. If you want a little crunch in your cupcakes, you can add 1/2 cup of chopped nuts. If you want a stronger chocolate flavor, add 1/2 cup of chocolate chips.

steps.headline: Fill and bake the cupcakes.
steps.description: Fill the muffin liners or holes so that they're three-quarters full of batter. Bake the cupcakes for 15 to 17 minutes in your preheated oven. A cake tester should come away clean if you poke the center of a cupcake with it. If not, let them bake for a few more minutes and then test them again. Let the cupcakes cool completely on a wire rack before you frost them with a frosting or icing of your choice.

steps.headline: Replace eggs for moisture.
steps.description:
Consider the cupcake recipe that you'd like to adapt. If you left out the egg or eggs from your recipe, would the batter be dry? Cupcake batters should be smooth and somewhat runny. If your batter would be dry, you need to substitute the eggs for a different ingredient that will provide moisture to the batter. Consider increasing the baking soda/baking powder by 25 to 50 percent and replacing 1 egg with:
Fruit juice
1/4 cup of milk or water
1/4 cup of fruit puree (like mashed bananas, unsweetened applesauce, pureed prunes or dates)

steps.headline: Use a mixture of tofu and yogurt.
steps.description: Instead of using eggs in your recipe, mix together equal parts of plain yogurt and silken tofu until they're completely combined. Use 1/4 cup of this mixture to equal 1 egg in your cupcake recipe. You shouldn't use this as an egg replacer if you recipe calls for 3 or more eggs. If the recipe calls for a lot of eggs, just use an egg substitute product.

steps.headline: Use an egg substitute.
steps.description: You can buy a commercial egg substitute from the grocery store (in the baking aisle). Follow the manufacturer's instructions to mix it up. You'll probably have to stir together 1 1/2 tablespoons of the dry egg substitute powder with 2 to 3 tablespoons of warm water to equal one egg. Egg substitute is a good choice is you're worried about other types of substitutions changing the flavor of your recipe. Egg substitute won't change the flavor of your cupcakes.

Making Eggless Vanilla Cupcakes Using Applesauce Preheat the oven. Turn on your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Take out a 12 cup muffin tin and place muffin liners in each hole. If you don't have muffin liners, grease and flour the holes or spray them with cooking spray. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/94\/Make-Eggless-Cupcakes-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/94\/Make-Eggless-Cupcakes-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":508,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} To make the cupcakes come out even easier, consider spraying the muffin liners with cooking spray. This can also help them brown more evenly during baking. Mix the dry ingredients. Place all of the dry ingredients into a medium bowl and whisk them for about 30 seconds. This will break up any lumps, aerate the flour and distribute the leavening. To make 12 eggless vanilla cupcakes, you'll need these dry ingredients: 1 1/2 cups (180 g) of cake flour 1/2 teaspoons of baking soda 2 teaspoons of baking powder 1 pinch of salt Combine the butter and sugar before adding applesauce. In a separate medium-sized mixing bowl, cream the 1/2 cup (115 g) of butter with the 1/2 cup (100 g) of sugar. Beat them for a few minutes until the mixture is light and fluffy. Take a rubber spatula and fold in 1 1/4 cup (236 g) of unsweetened applesauce. Avoid stirring the applesauce in too much or the butter and sugar mixture will become dense. Simply folding in the applesauce, using a twisting motion with your wrist, will make light and fluffy cupcakes. Stir in the milk. Stir 1/2 cup (120 ml) of milk into the wet ingredients. Gently stir in the milk so it's combined with your butter, sugar and applesauce. The mixture will look very runny and wet. There shouldn't be any lumps. You can use any type of milk. Keep in mind that the milk higher in fats will make richer cupcakes. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Take the bowl of dry ingredients and carefully add the dry ingredients to your bowl of wet ingredients. Stir the dry ingredients in using a rubber spatula. Stir until the ingredients are completely combined. The cupcake batter will still be slightly runny and smooth. Divide the batter among the muffin tin. Use a measuring scoop, spoons, or a cookie scoop to fill your muffin liners or greased muffin holes with the cupcake batter. Fill each muffin hole or liner two-thirds full with the cupcake batter. Cookie scoops are easy to use when filling the liners. Depending on the size of your cookie scoop, you may need a few scoops of batter for each liner or hole. Bake your eggless vanilla cupcakes. Place your filled muffin tin in the preheated oven and bake the cupcakes for 15 to 20 minutes. Test the cupcakes to see if they're done by inserting a cake tester or toothpick in the center of a cupcake. If it comes out clean, the cupcakes are baked. If it comes out with batter stuck to it, the cupcakes need to bake longer. Add just a few minutes baking time to your cupcakes and keep checking them for to see if they're done. Cool the cupcakes. Remove the cupcakes from the oven and let them cool in the muffin tin for a few minutes before removing them to a cooling rack. Let the cupcakes cool completely before frosting them or eating them. Store the cupcakes in an airtight container until you're ready to eat them or frost them. You can use almost any flavor of frosting to finish these eggless vanilla cupcakes. Making Eggless Chocolate Cupcakes Using Bananas Preheat the oven. Turn on your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Take a 12 hole muffin tin and grease and flour it. You could also line the muffin pan with cupcake liners or just use cooking spray. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b7\/Make-Eggless-Cupcakes-Step-9-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b7\/Make-Eggless-Cupcakes-Step-9-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":508,"licensing":"

\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} You can also spray the cupcake liners so they peel away easily from the cupcakes. Combine your dry ingredients. Place the dry ingredients in a medium-sized bowl and whisk to combine them. You shouldn't be able to see any lumps and the cocoa should be evenly distributed so the mixture is a light brown color. Put these dry ingredients in the bowl: 1 1/4 cups (156 g) of all-purpose flour 1/3 cup (40 g) of cocoa powder 1 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder 1 teaspoon of baking soda 1/2 teaspoons of salt Mix together the wet ingredients. Put 2 mashed bananas and 1/2 cup (100 g) of granulated sugar into a separate large bowl. Stir them together. Stir in the following wet ingredients: 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons (82 g) of vegetable oil 1/2 cup (120 ml) of milk 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract Stir together the eggless chocolate cupcake batter. Add a little of the dry ingredient mixture to your large bowl of wet ingredients and stir it together, using a rubber spatula or wooden spoon. Add the rest of the dry ingredients and stir the batter until there aren't any lumps or pockets of flour. If you want a little crunch in your cupcakes, you can add 1/2 cup of chopped nuts. If you want a stronger chocolate flavor, add 1/2 cup of chocolate chips. Fill and bake the cupcakes. Fill the muffin liners or holes so that they're three-quarters full of batter. Bake the cupcakes for 15 to 17 minutes in your preheated oven. A cake tester should come away clean if you poke the center of a cupcake with it. If not, let them bake for a few more minutes and then test them again. Let the cupcakes cool completely on a wire rack before you frost them with a frosting or icing of your choice. Making Your Own Recipe Eggless Replace eggs for moisture. Consider the cupcake recipe that you'd like to adapt. If you left out the egg or eggs from your recipe, would the batter be dry? Cupcake batters should be smooth and somewhat runny. If your batter would be dry, you need to substitute the eggs for a different ingredient that will provide moisture to the batter. Consider increasing the baking soda/baking powder by 25 to 50 percent and replacing 1 egg with: Fruit juice 1/4 cup of milk or water 1/4 cup of fruit puree (like mashed bananas, unsweetened applesauce, pureed prunes or dates) Use a mixture of tofu and yogurt. Instead of using eggs in your recipe, mix together equal parts of plain yogurt and silken tofu until they're completely combined. Use 1/4 cup of this mixture to equal 1 egg in your cupcake recipe. You shouldn't use this as an egg replacer if you recipe calls for 3 or more eggs. If the recipe calls for a lot of eggs, just use an egg substitute product. Use an egg substitute. You can buy a commercial egg substitute from the grocery store (in the baking aisle). Follow the manufacturer's instructions to mix it up. You'll probably have to stir together 1 1/2 tablespoons of the dry egg substitute powder with 2 to 3 tablespoons of warm water to equal one egg. Egg substitute is a good choice is you're worried about other types of substitutions changing the flavor of your recipe. Egg substitute won't change the flavor of your cupcakes.
